meanings.definition: The last day of the world's existence.
meanings.sent1: On doomsday, everything will come to an end.
meanings.sent2: People fear the arrival of doomsday.
meanings.sent3: The cat acted like it was doomsday when the vacuum cleaner turned on.
meanings.sent4: The storm approached like a doomsday on the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The idea of doomsday lingered in their minds like a shadow.

meanings.definition: A time of catastrophic destruction and death.
meanings.sent1: During the doomsday, chaos reigned supreme.
meanings.sent2: The survivors struggled to rebuild after the doomsday passed.
meanings.sent3: The doomsday party turned out to be a disaster.
meanings.sent4: The doomsday scenario played out in their worst nightmares.
meanings.sent5: The doomsday scene was like a painting of despair.

meanings.definition: A day of judgment or reckoning.
meanings.sent1: On doomsday, all secrets will be revealed.
meanings.sent2: Many believe in the concept of a doomsday for the wicked.
meanings.sent3: The doomsday for procrastinators is the deadline.
meanings.sent4: Facing the consequences felt like a personal doomsday.
meanings.sent5: The doomsday of truth will come for those who deceive.
